title: Cisco Secure Email Gateway
descriptionMarkdown: The [Cisco Secure Email Gateway (SEG)](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/security/email-security/index.html) data connector provides the capability to ingest [Cisco SEG logs](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/esa/esa14-0/user_guide/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_14-0/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_12_1_chapter_0100111.html#con_1061902) into Azure Sentinel.
additionalRequirementBanner: This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**CiscoSEGEvent**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-CiscoSEG-parser) which is deployed with the Azure Sentinel Solution.

sampleQueries.query:
CiscoSEGEvent
 | where isnotempty(SrcIpAddr)
    | summarize count() by SrcIpAddr
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: CiscoSEG_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CiscoSEGEvent
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
CiscoSEGEvent
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. [Follow these steps](https://aka.ms/sentinel-CiscoSEG-parser) to create the Kusto Functions alias, **CiscoSEGEvent**
>**NOTE:** This data connector has been developed using AsyncOS 14.0 for Cisco Secure Email Gateway

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux or Windows
instructionSteps.description:
Install the agent on the Server to which the logs are forwarder from Cisco Secure Email Gateway device (e.g.remote syslog server)

> Logs from Cisco SEG deployed on Linux or Windows servers are collected by **Linux** or **Windows** agents.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Follow the configuration steps below to get Cisco SEG logs into Azure Sentinel. Refer to the [Azure Monitor Documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/data-sources-json) for more details on these steps.
1. [Configure log subscription](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/esa/esa14-0/user_guide/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_14-0/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_12_1_chapter_0100111.html#con_1134718) on your Cisco SEG appliance.
2. Download config file [cisco_seg.conf](https://aka.ms/sentinel-CiscoSEG-conf).
3. Login to the server where you have installed Azure Log Analytics agent.
4. Copy cisco_seg.conf to the /etc/opt/microsoft/omsagent/**[workspace_id]**/conf/omsagent.d/ folder.
5. Edit cisco_seg.conf as follows:

	 i. specify port which you have set your Cisco SEG device to forward logs to (line 4)

	 ii. replace **[workspace_id]** with real value of your Workspace ID (lines 14,15,16,19)
5. Save changes and restart the Azure Log Analytics agent for Linux service with the following command:
		sudo /opt/microsoft/omsagent/bin/service_control restart

>**NOTE:** It may take up to 1 hour before CiscoSEG_CL table will appear in Custom Logs when you set up Cisco Secure Email Gateway data connector for the first time in Azure Sentinel.
